chargeHist.descr: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon

result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter R Cupp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must not consume intoxicating substances while on extended supervision.

Defendant Peter R Cupp in court and in custody with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State stands mute.
Attorney Bechtold recommends adopting PSI
Defendant addresses the court.

Court sentences incarceration initial confinement 2 years 6 months followed by 2 years 6 mo extended supervision for total of 5 years.  
131 days credit.  Not eligible for Challenge incarceration program.  Defendant is eligible for substance abuse programs.
May not consume intoxicating substances while on extended supervision.  
Voter ineligibility notice form and written explanation of determinate sentence provided to defendant.
Order for DNA sent to jail for defendant to provide before departing for Dodge.  

Jail Faxed

Defendant Peter R Cupp in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Defendant Peter R Cupp in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:13 Case called.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders PSI.  State requests bond be revoked.  Defense requests bond not be revoked and be modified to $1,000.00.  State objects.  Court revokes bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
